subject: p14851532
History: Year old man with pleural effusion, eval.
Impression: No relevant change as compared to the previous examination, the postoperative changes in the left upper lung and the scarring in the perihilar portions of the right lung are constant in distribution and appearance. There currently is no evidence of pleural effusions on the lateral and frontal radiograph. Status post CABG. Moderate elongation of the descending aorta. No pneumonia.
